Summary The ideal position I am seeking is one where my experience is utilized to fulfill a technical challenging environment, a position in leadership as a supervisor or maintenance manager.  
 
In my career which spans over 30 years in the field of semiconductor manufacturing I have been directly involved in the start-up of five new factories for Motorola and Intel. I am that person who drives the thought process within the thinking of other technicians to know where you have been, know where you are at and above all know where you are going. This fundamental thought process I have used throughout my career to develop programs and train technicians, how to be technicians. From good communications, troubleshooting and follow-thru post equipment repair, these fundamentals which I believe are lead from example of a motivated leader. 
 
The depth of years of my equipment/process experience itself as I have been told is a rarity in the semiconductor industry, then compound that with a honorable military service record and civilian education I am ready to accept your challenge.  
 
In addition I also have experience in the aviation industry from simple cable fabrication and repair to maintaining complex instrument and radar control systems. Working on aircraft and rockets requires a level of performance dedication with a attitude of the job must be done 100% correct the first time. This is a behavior which is still instilled into me today and I full support. 
 
I have an extensive knowledge from my experience for troubleshooting, repair, modification, calibration and testing of electronics and electrical mechanical systems using schematics and mechanical drawings. I have experience in working with MS Office using Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook. Statistical Process Control (SPC), 6 Sigma, High Performance Maintenance (HPM), 5S, and maintenance data reporting and data collecting programs. I have also written professionally in SGML as a technical writer. I am that person who drives the thought process within the thinking of other technicians to know where you have been, know where you are at and above all know where you are going. This fundamental thought process I have used throughout my career to develop programs and train technicians, how to be technicians. From good communications, troubleshooting and follow-thru post equipment repair, these fundamentals which I believe are lead from example of a motivated leader. 
 
The depth of years of my equipment/process experience itself as I have been told is a rarity in the semiconductor industry, then compound that with a honorable military service record and civilian education I am ready to accept your challenge.  
 
In addition I also have experience in the aviation industry from simple cable fabrication and repair to maintaining complex instrument and radar control systems. Working on aircraft and rockets requires a level of performance dedication with a attitude of the job must be done 100% correct the first time. This is a behavior which is still instilled into me today and I full support. 
 
I have an extensive knowledge from my experience for troubleshooting, repair, modification, calibration and testing of electronics and electrical mechanical systems using schematics and mechanical drawings. I have experience in working with MS Office using Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook. Statistical Process Control (SPC), 6 Sigma, High Performance Maintenance (HPM), 5S, and maintenance data reporting and data collecting programs. I have also written professionally in SGML as a technical writer.
